TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit Utf8Parser extends System.Object
public ref class Utf8Parser abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Methods to parse common data types to Utf8 strings.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool TryParse (ReadOnlySpan<byte> source, out bool value, out int bytesConsumed, char standardFormat = '\0');
.method public static hidebysig bool TryParse(valuetype System.ReadOnlySpan`1<unsigned int8> source, [out] bool& value, [out] int32& bytesConsumed, char standardFormat) cil managed
Public Shared Function TryParse (source As ReadOnlySpan(Of Byte), ByRef value As Boolean, ByRef bytesConsumed As Integer, Optional standardFormat As Char = '\0') As Boolean
static member TryParse : ReadOnlySpan<byte> * bool * int * char -> bool

Docs.param: The Utf8 string to parse
Receives the parsed value
On a successful parse, receives the length in bytes of the substring that was parsed
Expected format of the Utf8 string
Docs.summary: Parses a Boolean at the start of a Utf8 string.
Docs.returns: true for success. "bytesConsumed" contains the length in bytes of the substring that was parsed. false if the string was not syntactically valid or an overflow or underflow occurred. "bytesConsumed" is set to 0.
Docs.remarks: Formats supported: G (default) True/False l true/false
Docs.exceptions: System.FormatException if the format is not valid for this data type.

Docs.param: The Utf8 string to parse
Receives the parsed value
On a successful parse, receives the length in bytes of the substring that was parsed
Expected format of the Utf8 string
Docs.summary: Parses a DateTimeOffset at the start of a Utf8 string.
Docs.returns: true for success. "bytesConsumed" contains the length in bytes of the substring that was parsed. false if the string was not syntactically valid or an overflow or underflow occurred. "bytesConsumed" is set to 0.
Docs.remarks: Formats supported: G (default) 05/25/2017 10:30:15 R Tue, 03 Jan 2017 08:08:05 GMT (RFC 1123) l tue, 03 jan 2017 08:08:05 gmt (Lowercase RFC 1123) O 2017-06-12T05:30:45.7680000-07:00 (Round-trippable)
Docs.exceptions: System.FormatException if the format is not valid for this data type.

Docs.exceptions: System.FormatException if the format is not valid for this data type.
